text:
:champagne: _You have opened a new, empty shared channel._ 
_Share <https://www.smooz.io/room/5e735de1cca2270004e845e1|this link> with other teams to invite them in it_
<@U4VR52RQE> has renamed the channel from "z-shared-31" to "enrico-and-heather"
name: enrico-and-heather

text:
Hey Heather, please meet Enrico your incredible E-Mentor we've been telling you about :smile:. Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the mentorship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or penny-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:

Note: You will not see your match as a "member" in this channel however you can see from the chat history that they have joined/been added :smile:

Hi Heather! nice to meet you, my name is Enrico and I’m a Concept Artist/ Visual Development Artist from Italy. I’ve recently finished to work on a 2D tv serie at Blue Zoo in London as Environment Designer (basically I draw all the locations and some props). I mostly focus on 2D design but during the production of the show I was provided with 3D models from Sketchup to speedup the production. I’m also pushing my skills on ZBrush, so I can block basic shapes for my environment and have different angles for the same location. What about yourself? :)

Hi Enrico :slightly_smiling_face: nice to meet you too, thank you for connecting with me! wow that sounds great, I've never worked at Blue Zoo myself. I'm a freelancer based in Manchester, I used to work in VFX in London. I'm trying to move into concept art as a full time role and wanted some help getting there which is why I signed up for this! I've worked on a few things as a freelancer, tv series and animation for a little bit. But I'd really like to move into concept art/visual development full-time, hopefully in games as that seems to be the predominant industry up here in the North. I've built an art portfolio on the side ever since I was working in London, I keep adding to it when I can ( a lot more time now the COVID-19 thing has escalated!) that's really interesting you're pushing in ZBrush, I've used it myself a little but never for anything hard surface, it's always been really organic things.

Oh that’s cool, what were you doing as VFX artist?  And what kind of TV animation were you working on? Were you working on concept art? Was it cartoony/ kid style? That’s great your building your portfolio, if you want to send it to me I’ll have a look and let you know what I think about it! :) yes surely the actual situation is forcing / helping us to focus and be more productive, which is positive thing! Yes mostly I’ve done organic and a bit of hard surfaces but I’m at the beginning with that as well!
